attributes.action: change the law to allow the inquest into the death of any soldier outside of the UK to be held in a Coroners Court nominated by the next of kin.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The law at present requires inquests of returning dead service personnel to be carried out by the Coroner with responsibility for the area in which the military airbase which is used for repatration of the remains.  This causes distressing delays to the carrying out of inquests as the number of fatalities in Afghanistan and Iraq is increasing.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "change the law to allow the inquest into the death of any soldier outside of the UK to be held in a Coroners Court nominated by the next of kin."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number-10.gov.uk/output/Page11807.asp
